chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
w: nat -> R
v: nat -> R
u: nat -> R
l: Rbar

Goal:
(forall n : nat, u n <= v n <= w n) -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq w l -> is_lim_seq v l

Premises:
is_lim_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => filterlim u eventually (Rbar_locally l) : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
is_lim_seq_le_le_loc : forall (u v w : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n <= v n <= w n) -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq w l -> is_lim_seq v l
is_lim_seq_ext : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), (forall n : nat, u n = v n) -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq v l
is_lim_seq_ext_loc : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq v l
is_lim_seq_le : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l1 l2 : Rbar), (forall n : nat, u n <= v n) -> is_lim_seq u l1 -> is_lim_seq v l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2
is_lim_seq_le_loc : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l1 l2 : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n <= v n) -> is_lim_seq u l1 -> is_lim_seq v l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2
Sup_seq_ext : forall u v : nat -> Rbar, (forall n : nat, u n = v n) -> Sup_seq u = Sup_seq v
is_lim_seq_subseq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) (phi : nat -> nat), filterlim phi eventually eventually -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => u (phi n)) l
is_lim_seq_incr_1 : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l < -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => u (S n)) l
is_lim_seq_incr_n : forall (u : nat -> R) (N : nat) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l < -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => u (n + N)%nat) l
filter_forall : forall P : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x) -> ?F P where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
is_LimSup_LimInf_lim_seq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_LimSup_seq u l -> is_LimInf_seq u l -> is_lim_seq u l
filter_imp : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x -> Q x) -> ?F P -> ?F Q where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
filterlim_locally : forall (f : ?T -> ?U) (y : ?U), filterlim f ?F (locally y) < -> (forall eps : posreal, ?F (fun x : ?T => ball y eps (f x))) where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Type] ?U : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- UniformSpace] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
filterlim_const : forall a : ?U, filterlim (fun _ : ?T => a) ?F (locally a) where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Type] ?U : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- UniformSpace] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
filterlim_ext_loc : forall f g : ?T -> ?U, ?F (fun x : ?T => f x = g x) -> filterlim f ?F ?G -> filterlim g ?F ?G where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Type] ?U : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?G : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- (?U -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
is_lim_LimSup_seq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l -> is_LimSup_seq u l
is_lim_LimInf_seq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l -> is_LimInf_seq u l
filterlim_le_m_infty : forall f g : ?T -> R, ?F (fun x : ?T => g x <= f x) -> filterlim f ?F (Rbar_locally m_infty) -> filterlim g ?F (Rbar_locally m_infty) where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
filterlim_ge_p_infty : forall f g : ?T -> R, ?F (fun x : ?T => f x <= g x) -> filterlim f ?F (Rbar_locally p_infty) -> filterlim g ?F (Rbar_locally p_infty) where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
is_lim_seq_unique : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l -> Lim_seq u = l
filterlim_le_le : forall (f g h : ?T -> R) (l0 : Rbar), ?F (fun x : ?T => f x <= g x <= h x) -> filterlim f ?F (Rbar_locally l0) -> filterlim h ?F (Rbar_locally l0) -> filterlim g ?F (Rbar_locally l0) where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
filter_and : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, ?F P -> ?F Q -> ?F (fun x : ?T => P x /\ Q x) where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
ex_finite_lim_seq = fun u : nat -> R => exists l : R, is_lim_seq u l : (nat -> R) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
ex_lim_seq = fun u : nat -> R => exists l : Rbar, is_lim_seq u l : (nat -> R) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
is_lim_seq_Reals : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : R), is_lim_seq u l < -> Un_cv u l
is_lim_seq_spec : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq' u l < -> is_lim_seq u l
is_LimInf_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall N : nat, exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ u n < l0 + eps) /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> l0 - eps < u n) | p_infty => forall M : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> M < u n | m_infty => forall (M : R) (N : nat), exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ u n < M end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_LimSup_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall N : nat, exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ l0 - eps < u n) /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> u n < l0 + eps) | p_infty => forall (M : R) (N : nat), exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ M < u n | m_infty => forall M : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> u n < M end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_sup_seq_lub : forall (u : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar), is_sup_seq u l -> Rbar_is_lub (fun x : Rbar => exists n : nat, x = u n) l
Proper_StrongProper : forall F : (?T -> Prop) -> Prop, ProperFilter F -> ProperFilter' F where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R w : nat -> R l : Rbar |- Type]
